result.execSummary:
The defendant Morgan Ann Moreno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
-Concurrent to 15CF539, 15CF206 and16CF16.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 15CF539, 15CF206 & 16CF16

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond and balance of $204.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM667.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM667.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-MRT, Court orders Defendant to begin while completing condition time.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with New Richmond Wal-Mart of David Ask.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Defendant to pursue education or employment.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: CAR for SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Megan E. Kelly DF ATTY: Christopher Stephen Petros DF: Morgan Ann Moreno appeared. Case called at 2:47. Includes 15CM667, 15CF206. ADA Kelly updates the court. DE has been revoked on both files. Atty's agree on 320 days credit on both cases. On 15CM667 there is $404.00 still owed. ADA Kelly requests it be converted to a civil judgment. Court orders 8 months St. Croix County Jail on 15CM667 and 15CF206 concurrent with credit for time served. Court orders 320 days jail credit. Court converts money owed of $404.00 on 15CM667 to a civil judgment.
Filed by DOC. km

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Edward Minser DF ATTY: Alex Stormont DF ATTY: Greg Amann DF: Morgan Ann Moreno appeared from jail. Case called at 10:30.  Includes 15CF206, 15CF539, 15CM667, 16CF16. There are no corrections in the PSI. Atty. Minser updates gives sentencing recommendations. Atty. Stormont makes sentencing recommendations, DE has completed AODA in the jail. Atty. Amann makes sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Court rec'd letters from grandparents of DE. 

On 15CF539
Sentence I/S 7 years Total, 3 years initial. 4 years ES
86 days credit against ultimate sentence 
5 years probation with conditions:
- 6 months St. Croix County Jail
  Huber is authorized for work or seek work.
- AODA and any recommended follow through and treatment
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular testing. 
- MRT, Court orders to begin while completing condition time. 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, New Richmond Wal Mart, David. Ask.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00.
- Costs of $268
- DE to pursue education or employment.

On 16CF16 
Sentence I/S 3 years  Total, 18 months Initial. 18 months ES
102 days against ultimate sentence
5 years probation concurrent to 15CF539
- no condition time
- same conditions as 15CF539 
- Costs of $268
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00. 

On 15CF206 
2 years probation concurrent 15CF539, 16CF16 with the same conditions as 15CF539.
6 months St. Croix County Jail condition time concurrent to 15CF539 
- Costs of $243
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00. 
104 days credit against any ultimate sentence. 

On 15CM667
2 years probation concurrent to 15CF539, 16CF16 and 15CF206 with same conditions as 15CF539.
6 monts St. Croix County Jail condition time concurrent to 15CF539
- Costs of $243
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00. 

Apply bond on file.
Restitution requested of $1500, Atty. Amann to have 10 days to respond. 
DE elligible for substance abuse program and the challenge incarceration program. 
Bond is revoked, condition time is to start today.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: T Gregory Amann and Atty. A. Stormont DF: Morgan Ann Moreno appeared from jail. Case called at 1:34. Includes 15CF206, 15CF539, 16CF79, 16CF16, 15CM667, 15CF79, 15CF164. ADA Minser updates the court. Atty. Stormont agrees. Atty. Amann agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to amended Ct 1 in 15CF206 and to amended Ct 3 in 15CF206 amending it to 3-10 grams. DE pleads G to 16CF16 and 15CM667. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of  amended Ct 1 in 15CF206 and amended Ct 3 in 15CF206 amending it to 3-10 grams a class E felony and G of 16CF16 and 15CM667.On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CF206, Ct 4,5,6 in 15CF539, 16CF79, 15CF79 and 15CF164. Sentencing arguments. Court orders a PSI to be completed within 60 days. DE is remanded and bond revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Edward Minser DF ATTY: T Gregory Amann DF:  Morgan Ann Moreno appeared in custody. Case called at 10:30. Includes 15CM667, 15CF539, 16CF16. Atty. Amann updates the court, they are close to a resolution. Atty. Amann requests another couple weeks. Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  T Gregory Amann   DF:  Morgan Ann Moreno appeared from jail. Cases called at 3:55 pm. Includes: Prelim Hearing 16CF16, STC 15CF539 and PTC 15CM667. DEF waives right to prelim hearing. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court takes judicial notice of 15CF539. Bond continues.  Arraignment scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.

**Amended**
Includes: 15CF539, 15CM667, 15CF206, 15CF164, 15CF79
Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, David A or Donovan Flemming  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive.

Court authorizes Grand parents to transport DEF from Hudson Jail to Treament Facility in Chippewa Falls, WI with no stops in between.
If DEF is discharged from treatment facility she is to report back to St. Croix County Jail.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: T Gregory Amann DF:  Morgan Ann Moreno appeared from jail. Case called at 4:22. Includes 15CF539, 15CM667. Court bifurcates for the Arraignment only. State has filed information.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on 4 counts.  Waives speedy trial. Court orders State to provide discovery within 20 days. DE is trying to get into treatment. There may be a potential bond modification if DE gets into treatment. Court does not object for Branch 4 to make bond modification if Branch 3 is not available next week. Bond continues in form and amount.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 04:30 pm.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Morgan Ann Moreno appeared from jail via jail.   Includes 15CF539 and 15CM667. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on 15CM667 only.  Waives speedy trial.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

INCLUDES 15CF539 and 15CM667

Report every  Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

and  _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $1000.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.


It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  David A.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant in custody. eif
